articles.author: Andrew Goudsward
articles.description: U.S. Secret Service Director Kimberly Cheatle resigned on Tuesday after the agency came under harsh scrutiny for its failure to stop a would-be assassin from wounding former President Donald Trump during a campaign rally, according to media reports.
articles.title: US Secret Service chief resigns following Trump assassination attempt, media report

articles.author: Jarrett Renshaw, Nandita Bose
articles.description: Vice President Kamala Harris will campaign in the critical battleground state of Wisconsin on Tuesday for the first time as a presidential candidate after enough Democratic delegates pledged to endorse her, clearing her path to the nomination.
articles.title: Harris closes in on nomination with delegates secured, to campaign in Wisconsin

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu told families of hostages held in Gaza that a deal that would secure their loved ones' release could be nearing, his office said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Israel's Netanyahu says deal could be nearing for hostages in Gaza

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The death toll from two landslides in southern Ethiopia has jumped to 229 and could rise further as the search for survivors and casualties continued into a second day, a government official said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Death toll from Ethiopian landslides jumps to 229, official says

articles.author: Mohammad Ponir Hossain
articles.description: The Bangladesh government is expected to formally accept on Tuesday a court ruling to lower quotas for state jobs, media reported, meeting a key demand of the students who had been protesting for days.
articles.title: After protests, Bangladesh government to formally accept ruling on job quotas

articles.author: Sudip Kar-Gupta, Nicolas Delame
articles.description: The leftist France Unbowed party announced legislative steps on Tuesday to try to scrap French President Emmanuel Macron's pension changes and reverse a rise in the legal retirement age to 64 from 62.
articles.title: French leftists announce legislative steps to scrap Macron's pension reform

articles.author: Edwin Waita
articles.description: Kenya's police fired tear gas to prevent scuffles between groups of protesters and government supporters in the capital Nairobi on Tuesday, as youth-led demonstrations against alleged corruption and misgovernance dragged into their sixth week.
articles.title: Kenya police fire tear gas to stop scuffles between pro and anti-government groups

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Nearly a third of Ukrainians would accept some territorial concessions to Russia for a quick end to the war, a more than three-fold increase over the past year, although most still oppose giving up any land, a poll showed on Tuesday.
articles.title: Poll says 32% of Ukrainians open to territorial concessions for quick peace

articles.author: Emma Farge
articles.description: Countries and environmental groups voiced concern and disappointment on Tuesday after a draft treaty to cut fishing subsidies failed to pass, with China calling for major changes in how countries negotiate at the World Trade Organization.
articles.title: Fishing treaty fails at WTO, prompting US, Chinese concern

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Prosecutors in the southern Italian city of Crotone have informed two members of the coastguard and four police officers that they may face further action over a migrant shipwreck that killed at least 94 people, they said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Italian prosecutors investigate officials over Cutro migrant shipwreck
